rows.label: tev000392_MSG0001
rows.name: Hey, [ST:playername ].[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0002
rows.name: I was just trying to drill some combat skills into Shingo.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0003
rows.name:
We Pathfinders might not be a combat-first kind of
outfit, but it's not like the Ganglion and the indigens
just leave us alone.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0004
rows.name:
And when we do run into trouble, I'd like him to be
able to defend himself without having to rely on Saiden
or Mondo all the time.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0005
rows.name: Shingo's a pretty fast learnerâ€”he just lacks experience.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0006
rows.name: How would you train him if he was one of yours?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_JNK0010
rows.name: Strictly

rows.label: tev000392_SEL0011
rows.name: Suggest a brutal regimen with no room for failure.

rows.label: tev000392_JNK0020
rows.name: Supportively

rows.label: tev000392_SEL0021
rows.name: Say you'd guide him with positive reinforcement.

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0007
rows.name: Heh. Great minds think alike, eh?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0008
rows.name:
Way I see it, if he runs into an enemy outside the city,
I won't be able to hold his hand through the fight.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0009
rows.name:
So I've gotta drill everything I learned out there into
him before something happens to one of us.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0010
rows.name:
And there's a lot to learn. Not just stuff I've figured out
here on Mira, but lessons from back on Earth as well.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0011
rows.name:
All I ask is for him to be able to survive whatever
crazy thing happens next.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0012
rows.name:
Ultimately, if me or Saiden go down, I want to know
that Shingo is still able to go on without us.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0013
rows.name: Hmm. So that's really how you train people?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0014
rows.name:
I suppose I'd better positively reinforce the crap
out of him, then.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0015
rows.name:
I mean, he's going to be my teammate as well as my
student, right? Probably best I don't break the poor kid.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0016
rows.name:
But what happens if Shingo gets separated from the
team? Or god forbid, is the only survivor of an attack?
What then?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0017
rows.name:
The things he doesn't know are the very things that'll
get him killed.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0018
rows.name:
A rifle can't shoot for crap if it's not loaded with the
correct ammo, right?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0019
rows.name:
The indigens on this planet aren't gonna give him a
chance to learn from his mistakes. I need him to be
able to walk away from whatever happens to him.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0020
rows.name: ...Anyway, sorry if I got a little carried away there.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0021
rows.name:
I should go, though. I gotta run Shingo through a
Skell training session.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev000392_MSG0022
rows.name: See ya around.[ST:wait ]
